question_text:
What is the sum of the angle measures in this shape?
_°
backend_description: The image shows a pentagon outlined in green on a white background. The shape has five sides of varying lengths, and none of the angles or side lengths are labeled.
solution: Find out how many triangles make up a pentagon.

A pentagon is made up of 3 triangles, which each have 180°. Multiply.
3 $\times$ 180° = 540°
The angle measures of a pentagon add up to 540°.
solution_image_tag: The image shows a green pentagon with two diagonals drawn from the bottom-left vertex. The diagonals divide the pentagon into three non-overlapping triangles. All lines, including the shape’s outline and the diagonals, are shown in green.
